communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Copies of all records, documents, and materials held by the Virginia State Police relating to ransomware, malware, or hacking incidents from January 1, 2013, to the present day.

The requested information should include, but not be limited to:

1. Any investigative files, reports, memos, or correspondence related to ransomware, malware, or hacking cases involving individuals, businesses, or government entities within the Commonwealth of Virginia;
2. Any records of communication or cooperation between the Virginia State Police and other law enforcement, intelligence agencies, or cybersecurity firms in relation to ransomware, malware, or hacking incidents;
3. Statistical data or aggregated information concerning the number of ransomware, malware, or hacking incidents reported to or investigated by the Virginia State Police on an annual basis;
4. Any records of complaints, inquiries, or reports submitted to the Virginia State Police regarding ransomware, malware, or hacking incidents;
5. Any training materials, presentations, or guidelines provided to Virginia State Police personnel concerning the investigation of ransomware, malware, or hacking incidents.

Please search the relevant records systems of the Virginia State Police for the requested information.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Gabriel Garcia.

title: FOIA Request: Prince William County Board of Supervisors FOIA logs for years 2017, 2018, 2019

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: FOIA Request: Prince William County Board of Supervisors FOIA logs for years 2017, 2018, 2019
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Prince William County Board of Supervisors FOIA logs for years 2017, 2018, 2019, 2020, 2021, and 2022 (if any exist for those years).

I would prefer the logs to be provided in the format used by the Prince William County Board of Supervisors.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Gabriel Garcia.

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Scientology FBI
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All records, specifically including previously unreleased records from the dates of January 01 2018 to the date this request is processed, relating to or mentioning the Scientology or Church of Scientology. 

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies. Please search HQ records as well as ALL field offices and resident agencies.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Gabriel Garcia
